title: SEC-bench: Automated Benchmarking of LLM Agents on Real-World Software Security Tasks
data:
H Lee, Z Zhang, H Lu, L Zhang\xc2\xa0- arXiv preprint arXiv:2506.11791, 2025

imperative for establishing trust in their safe deployment throughout the software 
development lifecycle. However, existing benchmarks largely rely on synthetic 
challenges or simplified vulnerability datasets that fail to capture the complexity and 
ambiguity encountered by security engineers in practice. We introduce SEC-bench, 
the first fully automated benchmarking framework for evaluating LLM agents on\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\xa6

title: Security Degradation in Iterative AI Code Generation--A Systematic Analysis of the Paradox
data:
S Shukla, H Joshi, R Syed\xc2\xa0- arXiv preprint arXiv:2506.11022, 2025
The rapid adoption of Large Language Models (LLMs) for code generation has 
transformed software development, yet little attention has been given to how security 
vulnerabilities evolve through iterative LLM feedback. This paper analyzes security 
degradation in AI-generated code through a controlled experiment with 400 code 
samples across 40 rounds of" improvements" using four distinct prompting strategies. 
Our findings show a 37.6% increase in critical vulnerabilities after just five iterations\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\xa6
\xe2\x80\xa2

title: Smart Public Finance: Leveraging AI to Optimize Government Expenditures and Investments
data:
AL Paul
Effective management of government expenditures and investments is crucial for 
promoting sustainable economic growth and ensuring public welfare. Traditional 
public finance methods face challenges such as inefficiencies, limited transparency, 
and difficulties in forecasting due to complex economic environments. Artificial 
Intelligence (AI) offers transformative potential to enhance government financial 
management through advanced data analytics, predictive modeling, fraud detection\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\xa6

title: Policy Readiness for Tech-Driven Auditing and Public Finance Systems in Low-Income Economies
data:

transformative opportunity for enhancing transparency, accountability, and efficiency 
in government operations. However, in low-income economies, the success of such
